One kid, two girls, three rolls, four drinks...JK no drinks for us (we are more responsible drivers/parents than that) but not gonna lie those cocktails were calling my name.  While the vibe is more bar/date night than family dining, they do have half booths and a few kid safe menu options.

Roll one, the tropical thunder, a spicy panko breaded shrimp with spicy krab and avocado topped with shrimp and pineapple salsa.  The roll was definitely spicy, the salsa is the unexpected element that cools it down and sweetens it up, loved it. 

Roll two, red hot chili pepper, spicy tuna roll topped with sashimi sliced tuna and a spicy chili aioli.  It was not nearly as spicy as the name suggests, which was a little disappointing one the spicy meter.

We probably saved the best for last.  For our final roll, we did Chuck Norris, no pun intended.  If Chuck Norris were to eat sushi, he would poop out Pat Morita.  And if Chuck Norris where to be a sushi, he would be a spicy salmon and panko crusted shrimp inside, topped with sashimi salmon, avocado, fresh squeezed lemon juice and togarashi.  And he would be delectable.

Meh, I'm just not a fan unless a friend drags me here. The atmosphere is just a little too sterile for me, foods ok, beer choices are just ok. I'm not a fan of martinis but their martini menu looks great. Servers are usually awkward unless you sit at the bar.

Another date night means saketini night.

My hubby and I did not even make the 3pm-6pm Happy Hours.  I hate when I get the full bill when it should've been 1/2 off!  

I ordered the Berry and Buttah Face saketini.  The Japanese tongue-like berry felt like you're french kissing it.  I can't explain what the taste is like, but the drink had a fresh fruity taste.  Hubby is DD, yet again.

We ordered spider, Philadelphia, rainbow and salmon rolls.  The wasabi is blue, thus the name of the restaurant.  I don't really like the synthetic blue dye...oh well.  Butterfish, scallops, and yellowtail sashimi were excellent.  Mind you it's fusion and not traditional.  Some had a lemon gingery sauce, while others were soy based.  

Great place to have a girl's night out, too!   Definitely a great place to have your sushi fix!

My FAVORITE place to go for sushi and drinks! The food is so good here and the rolls are unique and well put together flavor wise. The fish is ALWAYS fresh which I am extremely particular with. I have been a pretty big sushi eater for years and finally we have something in Arizona which happens to be close to home where everything is fresh and always great! 

Another perk is they have Happy Hour on Saturday even! The service is excellent and all of the staff are friendly and welcoming! The overall vibe of this place very cool. A great place for a date, dinner with friends and even family's! Absolutely worth every penny!
Has the best sashimi. Try the salmon carpaccio sashimi.  The Tomb Stone roll is another favorite.

The sushi doesn't seem as flavorful and fresh as expected. Inside is a little cramped with the center bar area being too large to yell to friends on the opposite side. The happy hour food was meh but they sure don't skimp on the sake! I'd say better places for sushi and atmosphere.

First visit here was a few months back and really enjoyed it - great food, drinks, service.  Last night's visit complete opposite.  I asked for a table outside - there were two tables right outside the door that were open.  The hostess didn't seat me there, she instructed her helper to take me to a table way down in the back, behind a brick wall (all other tables were behind a metal fence, with heaters nearby) to a table all by itself.  The area was the outside service area - extra chairs, propane tanks for heaters (though no heater by my table), garbage, you name it.  I should have asked for another table.  The next two couples into the restaurant were sat at the two open tables, so perhaps the hostess didn't want to give a single diner a prime table.  Strike one.  My server was pleasant, seemed fairly new.  I didn't want to punish her for the table I was given (I was the only table she had outside) so I ordered my drink.  I specified Chopin vodka for my drink.  Judging by the headache I have today, they didn't use Chopin in my drink. (It is the only vodka on the market that I do not suffer headaches from.)  The menu states Chopin vodka is an $8.00 premium, yet my drink cost me $10.00.   Strike two.  The sushi I ordered was great - kudos to the chef.  

Strike three would have to be the server presuming I was finished just because I asked for a box for my left over sushi.  It's a terrible trend I notice at restaurants as of late.  Good servers allows diners to finish their meal before asking if they are considering dessert. I can say this as I have worked as a server.   More often than not I am asked if I want dessert while still in the middle of my entree.  In this case, I was not asked if I wanted dessert, she brought the check with the box.  I would have ordered dessert (which is why I did not finish my entire entree) had been given the opportunity.  Instead, servers these days seem to be in a hurry to get rid of patrons when they, the server decides the meal is over.  It would have added to the bill and her tip.  

I don't know if I will give this place another visit as there are so many sushi restaurants to choose from.

It seems the service keeps getting worse here. Sushi is decent but we won't be coming back. No refills on water, brought the wrong food, unorganized staff, half the heat lamps couldn't be used outside because they didn't have propane. Etc. Very poorly run restaurant!

Had a great meal with my wife and kids. We ordered a little bit of everything. And all of it was on point. The fish was very fresh and the staff were on it. From the moment we sat down we were taken care of. I want to thank the manger and staff for their great service. Also bonus, they made my wife her favorite roll from our old sushi place. A custom chicken roll. Amazing!!

First time visit, we happened to conveniently come during Happy Hour.   Sushi was very fresh and an excellent variety.  Some of our favorites were Shrimp Bizkit, Gordon Gecko, Chuck Norris and Go Adrian.  The martinis are a must.   Berry White, Mowie Wowie, and Magic Mike are all worth trying.   The toasted coconut sprinkled on the Magic Mike was awesome.  Service was top notched and very prompt.   Overall great experience and a great way to relax after shopping all day in SanTan Village.

Blue Wasabi is, hands down, the best sushi restaurant I've ever encountered. They have fresh, high quality ingredients and truly care about the work they produce. Everything from the eye-catching martinis to the innovative sushi rolls have been artistically thought out to deliver a unique taste that can't be found anywhere else (trust me, I've looked!).

The menu is big, but not overwhelming, and great for all types of eaters: gluten-free, vegetarian, non-sushi, new sushi, sushi snob (like myself). If you're not sure where to start, just ask your server. Everyone has been great and super eager to tell you their favorites!

**My must-try list is Rock Shrimp, Spicy Salmon Poke, and the Dam Jumper (not pictured)**

Our first experience in Arizona for sushi and I was absolutely pleased.  My son and I had ordered the California Roll and Spider Roll and the blue wasabi was a different twist on the flavor as well as the color.  It was not like the green wasabi which can clear nasal passages.  We also had the fried apple desert and it was delicious!

The spicy tuna sushi was fishy 
Loved the look of the place big screens to watch sports. It's very loud inside. Nice heaters outside. 
Very clean . Great staff...
Good Happy Hour prices and menu.  Seth and Manager did a great job working with a cranky, nonsushi loving 5 year old!  We all left happy and full!

Food and drinks were excellent!! My favorite was the crab wontons, the apple dipping sauce was so good! They were quick to take our order and deliver. The only thing stoping me from giving a 5 star rating is we are still sitting here 25 mins after finishing eating and we still don't have the bill. I think they forgot about us :(

So it turns out they did indeed forget about us. However they were so apologetic and completely comped our meals, which was more then we ever expected. For that I change my review to 5 stars. If that is not customer service I don't know what is.

Absolutely amazing food and service. Sit at the bar, enjoy a Berry White martini and spicy edamame.  This is a staple place for me and friends, never had a bad roll. Worth the price! Dam Jumper is my all time favorite!

Such terrible service. We have come to Blue Wasabi for 3 girls' nights. On the first 2 nights, we have been treated well by the staff until it approaches closing time. Once it comes close to closing time, the staff becomes exceptionally hostile and rude in their unsubtle hints to tell us that it's time to go home. Tonight, the obnoxious hints started 1 1/2 hours before closing time: glares, staring, rude remarks. We asked to speak to the manager about it, and he laid into us about how they should go home early. How ridiculous! We will definitely be choosing other places for girls' night in the future. I'm guessing this is why they are dead at night.

Wasn't thrilled with the sushi selection. We tried three rolls and would give all maybe a 4/10... We went to Rah Sushi last week and were treated to some of the best sushi I've ever had (for the same price as this place), so maybe my standards were set a little high... Also a little crowded with seating.. I love my ginger but theirs seemed like it was left over from a previous week... My favorite part of the experience was my wife asking the waitress to repeat the specialty roll named "Me Soy Horny".  Hahaha.
Went her for Ladies Night and loved it. Great drinks! The small plates were fabulous and our server was awesome and made some great suggestions.

We came over here as our second choice and now know it should have been our first choice. We enjoyed 2 delicious martinis,  yummy sushi, great orange chicken and attentive service. They seated us outside as we requested with nearly no wait time. Pleasant experience.  We'll definitely be back.

I went here for the first time for a first date and it was really good sushi and the service was great. However it was really pricey since we both got drinks. While I was there I asked about their happy hour specials. I went back during happy hour and was very satisfied by the food, service and price. My martini was amazing and I suggest the Marilyn Monroll.

I will never go there again. The owner is a jerk and I've never been so disrespected by a business owner before. I won't be going back simply because I dont want to give him any more of my money. Just from sitting at the bar I've seen how poorly he treats his employees as well, as someone coming from the restaurant industry that is simply unacceptable.

Dined for the first time. I'd give the atmosphere and friendly staff 5 stars but the food is alright, its not that great. They put a modern twist to their sushi. The blue wasabi does not taste like wasabi at all. There is no spice to it..too much food coloring.
It could be a decent place for beginners. For authentic sushi lovers, it's not worth it. Not worth it for the price of their sushi and the quality.

Been here a few times and the sushi itself is pretty decent.  Sitting outside on the side, not front, is nice.  The service tends to be a little slow and disorganized.  They brought the food out in a very strange order so half of us were always without, party of 6.  We had a good time nonetheless.  The rolls are ok, although I am more of a sashimi and nigiri guy.  The yellowtail sashimi was fresh, nigiris were what you would expect, miso soup could be better.  I had an unfiltered sake that was good.  Overall, not nearly the best sushi or ambiance around but not bad given the location and decent to good sushi.

We decided to try this place during happy hour.  The selection is more limited, of course, but it was a way to try it less expensively.

First, the wasabi really is blue.  I wonder how they did that.  Or, rather, what sort of chemical dyes they used.  Beyond that, it was very weak wasabi.  No heat at all.  The two of us used the entire ball between our bowls of soy sauce.  And then asked for more.  I don't know why it was so weak, but it was.

The sushi rolls we ordered both had cooked shrimp (tempura), which was unique.  The warmth was odd...I'm used to sushi being raw and cold.  They were tasty, but it was still "different".

We also ordered two beef dishes (I think they were called Ghengis and Lava).  They were both tasty.

I think I prefer more traditional sushi rolls.  These weren't bad, but I still can't quite get past the warm sushi pieces.  I am glad we came during happy hour, though, as I would not have been happy paying full price for the food we ordered.

Overall, not a bad place.  A bit pricey with several unique items.  I doubt I'll become a regular, but I would not be averse to returning for snacks or if I had some sort of coupon.  But probably not a full meal, and very probably not for full price.  It's not good enough for that.

We went in, a party of 4 on a Sunday... and they had a happy hour going on..  The hostess sat us at one booth.. only for me to see that it had food and sticky liquid all over it. So she tried to seat us elsewhere and same thing! I told her to bring me a rag and I'll clean it myself... and she actually let me! All the seats had food, crumbs, liquid all over them.

And the martinis were ok but they didn't even chill the martini glass!! WTH?! And they call themselves a martini bar?! Oh well...on to the sushi.. We ordered some rolls which were just all way to small to justify the $12 price tag... I won't go into details of what I didn't enjoy about the sushi.. but for this kindda fusion sushi, I think places like RA do it better.

So as we ate the rolls, the dynamite (eh..), salad.. baked shrimp app, martinis.. and waited for our check.. and waited and waited and waited.. we see the Manager just sitting around  the back of the restaurant and not checking tables (OR us) and completely ignoring the tables.. what on earth?! Why would you not check on a table that spends as much money as we just did??

And it's def NOT a place for sushi/sashimi afficionados!

Arg... feel like I wasted money :-(
It's the coolest place close to home.  Love the atmosphere and drinks.  Sushi in Arizona never seems that good to me, but overall I like this place and will continue to eat here.

21 Dec 2013

This was my first time going there, and I took my girlfriend around 4:30pm on a Saturday. It was already packed, so I had a good feeling! We got seated immediately since it was just the two of us. We looked at the menu and was surprised to see that they had half off selected sushi for 1/3 of the menu--maybe more.

We ordered a salmon nigiri and seared white tuna nigiri. Hands down these were the best in the area. We also got the Gordon Gecko, Eating Nemo and Chuck Norris rolls. Eating Nemo was a glorified california roll--I wouldn't get it a second time. Gordon Gecko was okay. Chuck Norris tasted like a Doritos. Even though we didn't really like the rolls, all of the fish served was fresh!

Love Blue Wasabi.  Blue Wasabi was voted best sushi in Gilbert.  They have a great happy hour and it is a great time if you just want to have some drinks and hangout with some friends after work.  If you like traditional sushi this place is not for you.  Blue Wasabi puts a unique twists on their rolls.  There Spicy Rockin' Shrimp Tempura is the best small plate they have.  You get the crunch from the tempura battered shrimp and then you get a hit of the spicy mayo on the back end.  Love it!
As far as rolls go you have to order the Chicken & Waffle Roll.  Yes, I said it Chicken & Waffle Roll.  You get the crunch of the chicken with the sweet maple syrup on the back end.  Mix that with rice and the juicy white meat chicken #mindblown!  Another one they have which is the best that is not on the menu is the Vegas Roll.  This is the best Vegas roll I have ever had...  The Vegas Roll contains smoked salmon, cream cheese, avocado, dynamite sauce, and is deep fried tempura style.  Anything fried I am sold!  If you have a craving for pounding down some sushi best time to head over is during happy hour and go to town!

BrandonFitFoodie

I've noticed a trend in my reviews. I'll go somewhere once, have an amazing experience then go a 2nd time only to be disappointed. After a stellar first experience, I came back again yesterday to have another stellar experience. The servers are all friendly and great at their jobs (yesterday, we had JJ who was super nice!). I should point out, I'm not a raw sushi gal. I stick to California rolls primarily and anything cooked. It's amazing to me that you can order a California roll at any sushi place but Blue Wasabi's was/is so much better! In theory, it's the same ingredients, right? Well, Blue's is so much better. I don't know how or why, but it is. My daughter got the orange chicken and said it was good but she'd prefer more sauce and maybe a side of rice. But overall, good. I love their crab wontons but don't care for the apple plum sauce. This is where the servers are great because I asked for Thai chili sauce instead and it was brought to me without question.  The flavor of the crab wonton filling is so yummy and I could eat my weight of these things. On my first visit, I also tried the Shrimp Tempura Roll which was fantastic and totally appeals to my soft-crunchy balance quirk in foods. My daughter at that visit, had Spicy Tuna Roll, seaweed salad, and tuna nigiri. Her favorite though was the Chuck Norris Signature roll. Everything is fresh, flavorful, and delicious. I love also that there are options for non-sushi people. Lastly, the Mello Jello martini is ridiculously good. It's like kool-aid and jello with booze but classier than a Jell-O shot. Love!!! I should get a frequent diner rewards because I'll be back!!!

This is a great place to eat. The atmosphere is really relaxing and the food is exceptional. The bar tenders and waiting staff are fun to be around. The sushi is great with some unique options. I highly recommend it for a good night out.

I was astounded that there were so many tables available at dinner time on a Saturday...today I think I am learning why. Only ate sushi. Partly my own fault for thinking sushi in the dessert was a good idea. Today I have enjoyed several bottles of pedialite for the 'common' effect associated with food poisoning. And Tylenol to ease the stabbing pains in my gut. Should have listened to my instincts... Called them to let them know what I ate, hoping that I could stop them from poisoning someone else. Manager said he would have another manager call me back.... Never happened. I guess this is a call they are accustomed to getting. 
Needless to say, I will not be going back.

UPDATE****** The owner had an incorrect number for me but was able to contact me through yelp and offered an apology. He also gathered information that could help him in finding out what happened.

Great selection of $5.00 martinis during happy hour.  On date, we had wango mango and lemon raspberry ice martinis.  Both had very good taste but little alcohol.

The krusty krab roll and drunken barbeque shrimp were decent.  A 3.5 stars each.  The spicy yellow tempura mushrooms were like a 2.5-3.0 star.

It's a very loud environment and very hard to hear her because she is not a loud person.  Waiter was very busy handling a lot of tables.  Understaffed.

We had fun here as it is a fun environment.  We might come back for the martinis but not the sushi.  lol.  sushi here is doable.

Ok... Half off alcohol on Sunday = big fat WIN!! I really dug this place for a minute, but tired of it easily. The drinks are good, and there are some inexpensive rolls and apps on HH, but it doesn't satisfy my sushi craving. I still haven't found that magical restaurant that ranks up with my multiple sushi joints in San Diego... Sigh. The search continues...
I went to Blue Wasabi for the first time today. The martinis were amazing and the food on happy hour was awesome. Ashlee was a great server and made great suggestions for my table.

Had a great experience here! Their happy hour is unbeatable and the drinks are good. Such a good place to go with the girls for a night out. Also, they have a great sushi selection that includes a number of rolls with NO FISH. That may sound pointless to many of you, but since I am highly allergic, it's refreshing to find a place that I can enjoy with all of my sushi-loving friends.

My husband and I love this place, service is on point ! And the sushi is bomb.com. 
Surf and turf is my favorite! 
Also the big daddy as well yum!!!! 
They also have great deals, follow them and you'll see them too ;)

We love this place. Although it only has 2 tables in the whole restaurant suited for families with small children, we always manage to get one of them. We love going there for happy hour when a lot of items on their menu are half off. Not just appetizers either, rolls and drinks are half off too! The service is always good and the food excellent. We love this place!

Who knew there would be more sushi restaurants in Phoenix than there are Starbucks in Seattle!  
Plates of pasta and carbo loading for races are totally passe.   The perfect balance of protein and starch was what we were all craving before the PF Chang Rock N Roll Half Marathon.  
Blue Wasabi was solid - the decor was  a little outdated and the drinks kinda fruity and corny, but the service was very friendly and the sushi was very good.  They had several intersting rolls, and the unagi was delicious (a good measure of the quality of a sushi joint, in my opinion)  
We left pleasantly full, but not stuffed, and perfectly satisfied.

I recently visited and while I thought my food was good the service was seriously lacking.Maybe I got the wrong server.I don't know... The server was not very friendly, almost stuck up and snotty.If we were not having such a good time talking, there was a group of us, I am sure I would have been even more annoyed at how slow it was to get  our food out. I know that sushi is not supposed to be a rushed thing, but  over an hour to get 5 dishes out? they brought one about every 15 minutes even though we had ordered our own individual orders.  Sea weed salad and cucumber salad was good.

Got here right after happy hour on a Friday and we were seated immediately. Our server was great and we were able to order pretty quickly. We ordered miso soup that was brought to us and it was really good. When I was half-way done, though, I realized that I was eating from a dirty spoon. Like, dirty. It was in the soup when it arrived and I didn't think to check. I was super grossed out and notified our server, who just said some were stained and brought new spoons. It wasn't stained. I could wipe the food off with my finger. Nasty. But I did not die. I was able to continue eating the ton of other food we had ordered and it was honestly excellent. I'll be back, but I'll definitely be checking to make sure everything is clean prior to sticking it in my mouth omg

Service was good. Was there at the beginning of happy hour. Food was ok. Had salmon sashimi(really thin and tasted smoky). Two martini's and a cucumber salad (cucumber salad is really simple but there was zero effort with this simple item)..
 I would go elsewhere if you are looking for thick cuts of fresh fish and good ginger. The ginger was really dried out and discolored. Food did come out fast, never waited long for anything, plenty of staff inside.
First time there, wont be back. Service was mediocre to poor, extremely noisy, sushi was good but nothing special. Overpriced for the quality.

My husband and I just went to  this place for happy hour . We ordered lots of sushi and some appetizers.  The quality was very low, I didn't even eat. The presentation and service was nice, it just seems to me they use cheap fish and sushi looked so dry .  And we spent almost $100 including drinks .I don't think we will ever go back .

This place is garbage, just another hyped-up trendy Sushi joint that "tries" to make up for their lack of quality with a "hip/modern atmosphere".  Been there once, will NEVER eat there again. The sushi is not good, the rice in our dish was hard, and the food was way overpriced. Of course, they have the usual airheaded ditzes and douchebags serving you food as if it's hurting them to smile. Don't waste your time with this pathetic attempt of a Sushi bar.

Great place for happy hour (get there early, it gets busy). Great selection of 1-of-a-kind Martini's and unique/signature sushi. Staff does a great job, 2nd time I've been here and look forward to coming back many times more.

Brian was truly an AMAZING server. Seriously. Clearly, I know what I'm talking about... I don't eat at home, just dust my appliances. They made me custom spicy scallops... was awesome :) thank you Chris!  Caitlyn was fantastic as well!

Tried Blue Wasabi this evening. Arrived around 5pm. The place was half full. After being seated we waited for 10 minutes as the wait staff ignored us. We got up and left without ever having a waitress or the hostess say a word and went to The Keg. I feel that we owe a thanks to the poorly managed staff because we had a great meal at The Keg. This would have been our fourth time at Blue Wasabi. The first two were actually good, while the last two were disappointing. No need to give them another chance.
Great happy hour deals. Love the dirty marini with almond-stuffed olives, and the tuna toro. Fast, friendly service during a busy time too.

So after chips,salsa and beer by the pool to celebrate Cinco De Mayo we all found ourselves somehow craving sushi for dinner :) We were a party of 6 so it seemed like by the time we all ordered there was one of everything on the table, all verrry good. We were sat quickly,got awesome service and all of the food was absolutely delicious. The wife and I ordered mostly Nigiri which was spot on. You can't really go wrong with Sake bombers (in my opinion) and those were excellent too. Fun place for dinner on a Saturday night but after reading the other reviews I'll have to check out their happy hour even sooner :) Will definitely be back!

The owner personally came to our table and chatted with me and three of my friends. We had awesome service, stellar food (Wango Mango Roll = Heaven) and even better drinks (get the Barry White martini - yum!).

Snag a table on the patio this time of year and enjoy the weather with friends!
sushi was mediocre, but way expensive for what you get. a little too trendy/annoying. plenty of other sushi places with better food and less about image-conscious patrons.

Ok during non-rush times.  Way too loud during happy hour and evening!

Always enjoyed sushi and drinks with friends and family.  A variety of unusual kinds of sushi... not all the names are family friendly if you know what I mean. Also, be aware of days closed... have been disappointed coming on day closed. 

Be prepared to walk a bit when parking.  Servers are hit and miss.

Cost wise I'd put this at $$$

Best fresh tasty sushi I've ever had!!!! Must try their salmon carpaccio!!!! Great and friendly service and a lots of fun you can have there again excellent food and atmosphere!!!!! Chicken wings to die for!!!!

Okay here's what happened...I walk into the restaurant around 3pm and the very friendly hostess, seeing that it's just two of us, asks if we wanted to just sit at the bar. My friend does all the talking and soon we are sitting at the bar. This is when my first experience went to the crapper. 

The bar tender was the worst server I've had in a while. When we first sat down she was so pushy about the drink menu kept pointedly asking what we would like to order - when we finally just asked for water she basically ignored us the rest of the time except to drop off our menus for our food. We didn't get our water until maybe 10 minutes after sitting there and we never got a refill. In fact after she took our orders - with the most disgusted look I'd ever seen - she didn't stop by after that to check up or to see if the food was good. When we were finally served our sushi (she didn't bring it to us) we were missing a whole order but she never stopped long enough for us to explain to her. 

What I don't understand is how she stayed so busy because let me tell you, there was NO ONE at the bar. We finally had to flag her down for our check and even asked to get more water after we got our check. I realize that we were sitting at the bar and so I'm sure she was bummed that our tab wasn't going to be as high since we only ordered water. But you get paid on service and I am still mad that she was tipped at all. She was a nasty doofis, with a muffin top and saggy boobs and if she ever wants to make enough off tips to buy support bras she's gonna need to attend a few more customer service oriented classes. 

Food wise I was not impressed with this place at all. Is the seaweed supposed to be slimy? I will definitely give sushi another try, but I wouldn't go here.

I really like this place!  I'm no sushi connoisseur, but everything I've had here has always been really good!  Happy hour is great....select food and drink items for half price...and it's in the whole restaurant.  Great service, fun atmosphere!  We will go back again and again!

So fantastic!! The Chernobyl beef is SUPER SPICY AND DELICIOUS!! Service was quick and very pleasant. The bartender recommended a wonderful martini for ladies night(1/2 off Martinis)...an Orange Julius :D all in all, a wonderful experience and great cuisine!

Went for happy hour with a friend. Really attentive bar staff and no waiting for food. They did ignore our request for all the food to be served at the same time, but since I put myself through college being a server, that is definitely something my review will overlook.  The parking is a little sparse at happy hour time, and the older gentleman sitting next to me fell over backwards trying to release himself from the heavy and tall bar chairs.  Maybe I should give five stars but, maybe there is just a TINY percentage that could be improved upon at this place.

I loved blue wasabi and have been going for over a year... I recently went back after not going for a month or so and it was so different. The rolls did not taste as good and the miso soup was completely changed. It was a dull flavorless soup. Pretty disappointed since I loved that place for so long!

Good Place. Cool seating arrangement (very family style). Happy Hour is a good value. Skyy Vodka drinks are like $4 each. Good value. Food was just above average. Not a Sushi guy, so I had the chicken, it was good, not great. Cool pre-spot maybe before the movies?

Meh... Just really watery martinis and poorly constructed sushi. Having paid an astronomical amount for very little food I left feeling guilty & ashamed that I let the hip veneer and cool vibe draw me in.   I live nearby and am disappointed that I don't have a stellar sushi spot in my neighborhood.
My husband and I love stopping by during the week for a quick bite.  The food is great and the staff is always friendly and helpful.

I'm not a big fan of sushi and never really wanted to try it, but after I had eaten here I'm a huge fan. The sushi was amazing and everything tasted great. The price is a little much but it is totally worth it. The atmosphere is good and the place is totally clean. Everyone is super friendly. Overall a great place to eat.

Wow, the wasabi really is BLUE!!  Enhance the name, however it didn't dawn on me until presented at the table.  What a rather interesting and fun experience.  

Their signature menu is filled with fun and ingenious names.  The happy hour is well priced and worth the ambiance.  We had a couple of yellowfin and salmon nigiris, in addition to the Me Soy Horny, Eating Nemo and Krusty Krab Rolls.   The nigiris were actually quite fresh tasting, however the rolls were mediocre.  I thought the usage of Jasmine rice didn't blend well and the texture was too rough to compliment the sushi.  I'd have to say I had better, but it was not bad at all (sorry, I've had great sushi before).  It was the first time I had "soy" wrappers instead of seaweed and I found it to be rather pleasant.  Almost like a tofu skin wrapper.

I liked the ambiance with cool and dark blues, low bar tables and hanging lamps.  Sleek, hip and modern.  The service was surprisingly courteous and the crowd varied from professionals to couples to groupies and families.  It all blended well somehow with the perfect amount of noise and light filtration.

Will definitely go back again if not for the food, then for the decent prices during happy hour and the atmosphere.  Maybe I'll get a martini this time around.
Quite easily the best sushi in town. Worth every dollar every time we go here. I'd highly recommend this place. Great first date and every other date night place too.

Pretty average place, nothing especial. First things first, sat down to 2 nasty glasses. 1 of them had lip stick still on the edge of the glass. Took a quick look around and there wasn't a water glass clean in the whole place. Then my daughter set her arm down on the table and found she put her arm down into something slimy. We were just about to get up and walk out but the waiter showed up and we decided to suck it up and see if they could redeem their selves. 
Our starters were the spicy edamame and squid salad. The waiter recommended putting the spicy edamame sauce on the side so we did. It was just a chili paste so no points for unique but the taste/heat was decent. I enjoyed the squid salad. 
Main dishes consisted of a California roll, Catapillar & their newest super ridiculously hot roll. The California was the basic traditionally, the Catapillar was as well and it really wasn't too special. There was hardly any eel in it. Now the super hot spicy roll that I can't remember the name of was actually pretty delicious. Had habanero and ghost chili aioli on it. 
For dessert we had that banana foster egg roll set up. It was good and it was needed to put out that little bit of heat on the back of the roof of your mouth.

All in all, this place could really work on its cleanliness. The rolls are average in size but not low in pricing so that would be nice if they stepped it up a bit. The new super spicy roll was a nice touch to the menu. The reason this place didn't get a fat 2 stars is because our waiter Jeremy was actually on point

My husband and I LOVE this place and always try to go on Sunday's when we can...there's just no beating 1/2 priced drinks and specialty martinis mixed with great food. Love the food, love the service (Jim the owner is great!), the atmosphere, everything. And always sit at the bar! The bartenders are always friendly and willing to (if you make nice) send some martini samples your way ;) 
You can't go wrong with the Tropical Thunder roll (my favorite), the Gordon Gecko, the pizza rolls (seriously don't skip these, they are not your typical pizza apps, and the Milky Way martini is amazing!

First of all, I thought it was pretty cool that this place actually did have blue wasabi. I went in a group of 6 for happy hour...the rolls and drinks were half off. The sushi was OK, but nothing special. They are also pre-made so you can't order the rolls to fit your liking which for me is important because I dont like crab, and many rolls contain that ingredient.  The service was not very good, but to give our waitress some credit it was crowded and she seemed pretty busy.

I went here with my brother's fiancé, and brought my dog to enjoy the beautiful weather. Skyler was our server. She was able to recommend the Badda Bing rolls, and I added avocado. They were delicious! Excellent recommendation! My friend got the Dam Jumper and was thoroughly impressed with her dinner as well. 
While we waited for the rolls, we shared a Buttaface. It was nice to enjoy a little dessert before dinner, occasionally. Britney brought us our meals and was an absolute pleasure. She got a laugh out of us asking why the Wasabi was blue!

All in all, it was a relaxing dinner with delicious food and great company. I'll definitely recommend this to my friends and ensure that Skyler takes care of us every time.

The food was decent. The drinks were good, but definitely juiced down(which is more flavorful than watered-down). I felt the price was a bit high for microwaved edamame and machine pressed rolls. I get the food colored blue wasabi, but it would be far better without the food coloring for taste- and where was the spice? Wasabi with no kick is like a broken pencil- no point! The atmosphere got loud quickly though not inappropriately. 
No tea?
Here's a quick rule of thumb- if a Japanese restaurant has no Japanese employees, expect American food. 
Overall, okay. I would return, but with far different expectations. As much as I love wasabi, I will be passing on it next time.

I went to Blue Wasabi yesterday for Happy Hour and had the Salmon salad, beef and brocoli and the tempura. 
 I got food poisoning and spent the evening throwing up. 
 When I called the restaurant to let them know, the hostess told me there is adisclaimer on their menu, and its ays raw food can cause food poisoning... Charming!!
 When I said she could continue the conversation with my lawyer, she called the manager who apologised, told me he was going to make a note, check the kitchen and keep an eye on it. He was bidding hios fareweels when I said I wanted my money refunded.
 - Ohhh... I can't do that. You need to talk to the owner.

WOW!! I am not asking to be compensated for the inconvenience. I am not asking them to pay for my meds. Or the time I wasted being sick after eating their food,

All I asked was not to be charged for the food that made me sick. And I could not get a straight answer... I am NOT IMPRESSED.

The "happy hour" portions on the sushi gets smaller and smaller everytime when come to this place.  The service sucks, had to call out for someone come to our table after being set for 15 minutes. The salmon on my and my wife's roll had salmon, and the edges was actually brown instead of pink.  The salmon was going bad.  DONE!  Will not come back to this place!

This place is what got me hooked onto sushi. I was never a very big fan of sushi until I came here. The food was amazing and super fresh. Their happy hour menu is pretty awesome too. Although, their sushi is a little bit more expensive than other places (you do get what you paid for here). It's expensive but their sushi is amazing.

I went to the sushi making class held once a month. When I first arrived there wasn't a lot of people but that soon changed. It was fully packed when it started. It took about 2 to 3 hours to learn how to make the sushi. 

Some guy next to me kept harassing me that I was going to cut my finger. But that was funny.

The rolls they had us make were not fresh ingredients. It looked like they were just trying to pawn off on us yesterdays groove. Which makes for a good marketing campaign and gets rid of old food.

"Hey how do we cut our costs of all the old food we have to throw away?", says owner.

"I gots an idear. Lets have a class and we can use all the ingredients we didn't sell and charge a lot for it.", says despondent grunt.

Brilliant idea guys. For the price of the class we should have gotten any two rolls off the menu we wanted. The teacher was a mono tone, tell all, never show twice type of person. He sucked at teaching and should stay in the kitchen. Sorry I never used a knife before. I am an idiot so don't treat me like another top chef.

The bell hop, button down, Forrest Gump looking waiter was so lurpy. He never came out quickly and tried to tell stories to the other couples on the ends of the teaching tables, probably trying to get tip money. I never felt more ignored in my life.

Never go here or anywhere near here.

We came here on a recommendation from a friend and had a blast.    Its kind of a funky setting with outside seating, and they make good sushi.    The service was good as well.  

The Tombstone sushi roll is going to keep me coming back here.   It's hot, seriously delicious and awesome.  

Come give it a try!   These guys are doing things right.

This place was way to pricey for me, especially having a "laid back" atmosphere.  It is a trendy place and I feel like sucker for giving them my business.  You don't pay top dollar for that kind of atmosphere.  And paying 12 to 14 dollars for a little martini is outrageous.  The food is good, not great.  There are plenty of hole in the wall sushi places that give you great food for what you pay for.

I'll try to keep it short, sweet, and to the point. Went there for industry night and had a terrible experience. The restaurant closes at 10pm. At 9:15 they did a last call. We got there at 9. When they did a last call about 45 minutes early I asked our waitress what time they close tonight. She confirmed 10pm but that they wanted to close early because no one was in the restaurant except us. They turned off all the tv's, turned on the lights, and closed the restaurant all while we tried to scarf down our food. It's so uncomfortable to be in a restaurant with staff members who look at you like you are a huge inconvenience. First of all the restaurants hours are posted as 10pm. Second of all its just plain rude. The sushi was expensive for what you got and their signature rolls were nothing to brag about. The nigiri was not fresh and was smaller portioned then other sushi restaurants I have been to. There are much better options for sushi out there.

Our favorite place to go for date night! Happy hour is 4- 6 and the martinis are very tasty - it's easy to get carried away. The servers are great and super helpful. The Chuck Norris and Taylor Swift are our favorites!

Blue Wasabi definitely gets a one thumb up  from the nice inside decor ( the blue chairs add a really nice touch and play within their name) to the staff and food great great great. Stephen was my waiter, he was a great waiter that paid attention, came when needed and never was a bother. There was not a wait although I did come during their 4 PM happy hour. As I was leaving around 6 PM the restaurant started to get crowded and over the hostess say there was a 45 min wait, mind you this was a Saturday. My wife and I ordered the crab wantons for an appetizer and later order 4 different sushi dishes l, which were all delightful. Overall everything was great besides the one little hiccup of when I order a glass of wine, the rim of my glass had dried up red lip stick, this is a big no no. Stephen was really nice about it quickly got me another drink. 4 stars and 1 thumb up is good enough for me definitely will go back when the wife and I want cheap happy hour drinks and great sushi.

Got there right before happy hour. Our waiter was awesome and he gave us explanations on all we asked for. Drinks were great, however the dishes lacked proper washing. The waiter was cool about it and replaced the wine glass with the lipstick stain with great empathy. Food was great and loved the decor.

The happy hour here is legit!! My friends and I got here on a Fri around 430 and it was packed already, we waited about 15 minutes for a table. The happy hour sushi specials are really good & everything we had was delicious. The only weird thing to me was that the regular sushi wasn't on HH- $6.50 for a California roll during HH is a bit steep in my opinion. Also, they have good drinks (pom pom!) and wines. I will definitely be back!

Poor management. We had a table of 6 and went specifically on Monday which is industry night because they give other people in the restaurant industry a 50% discount. The server told us we were good when we mentioned that 3 out of 6 were in the industry and he told us that we could have two people on each tab and still get the discount. So we get our bill and two of us showed very little proof to the manager that we were in the industry and got the discount. The 3rd person in the industry had more proof then anyone and the manager refused to give him the discount. The server should have told us what was required before we ordered. Had we known we wouldn't have gotten the discount we would have gone elsewhere. Even after we told the manager that the server didn't inform us of what was needed he still said we couldn't get the discount. Poor management over $40 bucks. He just lost 6 regular customers.

We went for a triple date night and it was a great choice. Their happy hour was fantastic (items are noted on the menu which have special, half off, happy hour prices). We stated with a round of saki bombers and edemame - delicious. 

I had the california rolls and macadamia crusted chicken - both were delicious. My boyfriend got 3 plates of rolls and an appetizer... what a champ (picture uploaded). 

Excited to go back and try it again.

Update returned and waited 8 minutes and not one server came around to greet us! It was not busy as it was 8:45 at night and we finally left after I filled our water with the container sitting by our table. Very disappointing as this has been our go to sushi place and it seems like every 1/5 time we go we get crappy service or none in this instance.


Normally very good, one of our favorite spots to go on a late night date night. However tonight when we arrived the table was poorly bussed, the menu and napkins had food on them from the previous guests. The sushi was still amazing, but tonight we were disappointed with the lack of quality we are us

Food is great, however, the portion sizes have been drastically reduced!  Making the food not that great of a deal anymore.  The owner, Jim, is a very rude person, he is cocky, arrogant, not concerned with customer service, and he treats his employees poorly!  I have witness Jim speak rudely to his staff, and he does so right in public. Great that he owns the place, but he needs to make Happy Hour longer, and more days of the week, a rush to go to a 2 hour Happy Hour is insane!  And he has decreased the quantity of food, and it is no longer a good deal.  The way he treats his employees is first and foremost, then the ever decreasing amount of food per order is the second reason we will never be back!

If you're into restaurant/bars where 30-something women go to hang out after loudly announcing, "OMG! Sushi and Martini Monday!" after a rough day at the office, then this your place. Or perhaps if you're into trendy bullshit like trying to look sophisticated while you sip your appletini and eat over-seasoned edamame, then Blue Wasabi is your spot. If you're into a tasty, cool and refreshing glass of water to cure that parched palate, then by all means, check out Blue Wasabi.

But if you're into good sushi, go somewhere else. 

2 stars because my water was good.

Came here for happy hour.  Sat at the bar, wonderful service from Skylar our bartender. Answered all our questions and even had the owner Jim stop by to make everything was beyond our expectations. Definitely worth the stop, we will be back!!

Woohoo, it is as good as it gets!  Happy Hour or should I say two happy hours (4-6 p.m.).  As a first time customer, I went with a friend on Thursday and was amazed at the happy hour pricing and the quality of the food.  We had the Dirty Sanchez and the Gordon Gecko and to paraphrase from the movie Wall Street, it was almost to beautiful to eat!  The Dirty Sanchez is melt in your mouth delicious....It was so good we ordered a second.  The Gordon Gecko has jalapeño but don't let that scare you.  It had just the right spice.  Paired with happy hour drinks prices and great service, I cannot wait to go back.  I was dreaming of my return before I even left the place.

Had the Crab wontons and a chuck norris roll. Crab wonton were ok. Skimpy on the fillings. Nothing special. Chuck Norris would be disapointed with his name on the roll. It wasn't Kick A$$. The food was OK. Nothing exciting. I have had better and I have had worse.

This is hands down my favorite happy hour in Gilbert. I've been here a million times over the past 10 years. I figured it's probably time to review the place on Yelp.

I really like their ambiance, décor and service. My only complaint regarding atmosphere is that sometimes it can get extremely loud inside, but that's dependent on how busy it is and people's voice level. So I don't fault the restaurant for that.

Food... I've tried so many things. I suppose I'll just make a list and give brief descriptions/thoughts.

Chuck Norris Roll- Absolutely love it but I order it without lemon juice. The lemon juice is so overpowering that it ruins the roll for me.

Dam Jumper Roll- So so good. However, not for the faint of heart. This would not be something I'd have a sushi rookie try since there is no rice or seaweed on the outside... It's all seafood. A piece of raw salmon rolled around crab, avocado and cucumber!

Wango Mango Roll- It's okay. Very basic. Reminds me of a California Roll with mango.

Shrimp Bizkit Roll- Not a fan. I don't like how the shrimp tastes on top (usually rubbery and not seasoned) and I don't like the asparagus either.

Me Soy Horny Roll- It's okay, but not one of my favorites. Something about the soy paper is a bit odd to me.

Krusty Krab Roll- I loveeee this one! Probably because it's fried lol! Love the combination of seafood and love the two sauces on the plate for dipping.

Gordon Gecko Roll- Not a huge fan as this always seems very plain/bland to me. There aren't any strong flavor profiles that make me want to eat more of it.

Yo Adrian! Roll- The dill is weird. I don't love it.

Orange Chicken- It's pretty good but not as good as Panda Express. :)

Lava Beef- This is pretty good and pretty spicy! Reminds me somewhat of a Panda Express dish though.

Drunken BBQ Shrimp- I love this shrimp and the sauce it comes in!!!!! My only complaint is that the bread they serve with it is always really hard/crunchy. That makes it hard to soup up the leftover sauce with the bread. :(

Crab Wontons- Our fave. We love these. The apple plum sauce they come with is amazing.

Cajun Seared Tuna Sashimi- My husband loves this and gets it every time we go. The flavor of the sauce is yummy, I'm just not a big fan of sashimi!

In terms of alcohol, my favorite signature drinks are the Agent Orange and the Wango Mango. I also love the Milky Way but it is definitely a drink for dessert! I don't like drinking it with sushi.

Overall, obviously I love some things and dislike others. They have so many items on their happy hour menu that if you go a couple times, you'll find your favorites! :)

I used to like this place. When I first came here a couple of years ago it was amazing! Delicious drinks, top-notch service and great sushi rolls. The last two times I was here the service was unprofessional, the drinks only so-so, and the sushi mediocre. The prices here are way too high for what this place now offers. I do NOT recommend.

If you seek sushi alone, this place will only be "ok." In my opinion, this place could appeal to a group seeking a light lunch, comprised of sushi lovers, those that don't know if they like sushi, or those that do not like it at all. The menu has a nice variety of rolls that stray from the traditional "raw" the sushi lover would typically seek.

But therein lies the appeal. Kids, sushi "fearers," seniors, etc - can get a roll that will make them feel like they actually tried sushi - or they can opt for "bar food" of wings, pizza rolls, sliders, chicken strips, etc. 

Which brings me to the downside. Nothing here will be memorable. Only "ok." But sometimes OK is good enough. When it is and you're nearby, this is an OK choice.

I really wanted to like this place more than I did...

The sushi was... not impressive. Only one (Yo Adrian) out of the four happy hour sushi rolls I ordered was decent.

Chuck Norris
Spicy salmon and panko crusted shrimp inside, topped with sashimi salmon, avocado, fresh squeezed lemon juice and togarashi.
My complaint: WAY too much togarashi. It overpowers everything else and it was the only thing I could taste. 1/5

Krusty Krab
Spicy tuna, avocado and krab, tempura'd and served over a spicy aioli drizzle. 
My complaint: This is all tuna with very little crab. I would have enjoyed this more if it was a more even mix. I also don't think they use sriracha mayo for their spicy mix which I think could improve this roll. 2/5

Gordon Gecko
Shrimp tempura, jalapeño, and cucumber topped with avocado, seared tuna and spicy mayo.
Complaint: This one was better than the last two (I find it hard for anyone to mess up shrimp tempura) but the avocado was NOT fresh. 3/5

Yo Adrian!
Cream cheese, krab and tempura green onion inside, topped with smoked salmon sashimi and chopped dill.
Complaint: I wish they used real crab but I liked this one. Wasn't the best sushi I ever had but it was pretty decent. 4/5

Milky Way Drink
Okay so on their online "Happy Hour" menu this drink is described as: Milky Way
Sobieski Vanilla Vodka, Dutch Chocolate Liqueur, Irish Cream, and vanilla cream with a caramel rim. 
On their "Specialty Martini Menu" the drink is described as: Pinnacle Chocolate Whipped Vodka, vanilla infused cream, and chocolate with caramel rim. 
Complaint: I ordered, expecting the first. Pretty sure I got the second. My fault for checking the online menu and not looking at the physical one but they should change their online menu to reflect the one they serve. 4/5

I also ordered the miso soup but we were sitting outside and in the Arizona heat that was a terrible idea on my part so I won't review this item. 

Service was a 5/5. Bathroom toilets don't flush or there is some trickery involved with it. Girl in the next stall also couldn't figure it out.

Overall: Come during happy hour and it's decent. If I had purchased this during normal hours I would have given this a 1/5 and complained to a manager.

Their Happy Hour is very IMPRESSIVE! Drinks are AMAZING! The Orange Dreamsicle one is what I get every time. It is only like $5 for happy hour and is very large. The Macademia Nut Crusted Chicken Strips with Sweet Chili Sauce is to die for and only like $4. Such good happy hour specials. Very hip atmosphere. The only small complaint that I would even have is that I wish it opened earlier. I went there two different times in the afternoon and it was not open until dinner, bummer. Now I know. Amazing Food, Drinks, Service and atmosphere!

...they served us Kraft (from a box) Mac and Cheese!!!!

I used to like this place but after I last visited with my wife who is pregnant I will never go back!!!
The sushi was always good...not great...but good. The prices have always sucked $$$$ way too high for what you get. They go down a bit for happy hour but there are much better places in the area with way lower prices. Blue Wasabi is a trendy place however!!

Getting back to the pregnant wife....She can't have sushi so...
She ordered a little of this and a little of that. One of her favorite things in the world is Mac and Cheese. Most restaurants these days have out of this world versions that are mouthwatering, not Blue Wasabi!!!
They served us Kraft (from a box) Mac and Cheese!!!! I was appalled but as a rule I never complain about food in a restaurant... that is what yelp is for!
There is no excuse for this!
With all my reviews I will give them another chance if the owner addresses this review on Yelp...until then...stay AWAY!!!

I've been to Blue Wasabi a couple times now and it's well.. just okay really. They put a lot of creativity into the names and ingredients in their signature rolls, I admit.... but not creative enough to try different types of fish. I can't begin to say how many I saw with shrimp tempura in them. Love shrimp.. love tempura.. but not usually in my sushi.

Last time I ended up getting the summer lovin, which was wrapped in pink soy paper (yes, sometimes I'm that shallow), the veggie specialty roll with salmon added to it, and the spicy scallop. Everything was okay, but not the greatest. The summer lovin was ginormous and hard to eat gracefully. I mean, aren't you supposed to magically turn into a hot manga babe when you eat sushi? If so, the summer lovin' definitely ruined my shot. I did, however, appreciate the willingness to add salmon to the veggie roll.

Another thing I appreciated... the banana dessert, though honestly, you'll want to share this with someone else after gorging on sushi.. I know I'm not the only one who does that. However, it's worth it... it's truly divine.

The service was kinda hit or miss. We waited a bit after we got our sushi due to not having any place settings. We also received more attention from a server that wasn't ours as opposed to our own.

Additionally, I don't deal well with places that don't give me a resting place for my chopsticks.

I am from California originally and was always skeptical about getting fresh seafood in the desert, but Blue Wasabi is always so fresh. I have always had really friendly and prompt service as well. Definitely a must if you are in the area.
They had fresh uni today and it was amazing! Thanks to Bush for letting me know it was in. I always have a great time here.

I went here for late lunch/ happy hour on my break from work so I was eating alone at the bar. The initial experience was nice but a few things bothered me. I ordered the Gordon Gecko, it was supposed to have jalapeños in it but I didn't taste any heat at all and didn't see them. As I was eating my meal no one came to check one me,I DIDNT EVEN GET A REFILL ON MY WATER! And I had a manager (im assuming he was because he was wearing black) come by and SNATCHED the paper covering from my chopsticks without acknowledging me or saying excuse me or anything. Then when I was clearly done eating I sat there forever waiting for someone to take my dishes or bring my check. I had to ask the sushi chef to go get the bartender to bring me my bill. And it wasn't like they were busy, there were tons of employees hanging out and talking instead of doing their jobs.

I was meeting with a group of colleagues for drinks and dinner.   I arrived with 5 minutes to spare for happy hour so had my order ready for the server. .. Never saw him until 5 minutes after happy hour was over, so 10 minutes total.   The service continued to be slow throughout the evening and was not worth the 18% gratuity automatically added to the check.   The restaurant was busy but it's Friday night so perhaps adequate staffing would be good.  I can get over slow service if they are at least apologetic,  but that certainly wasn't the case.   The manager was clearly irritated by our request to keep some chairs open for late arriving guests, even though we had been told earlier it wouldn't be a problem.   The food was ok, a bit on the bland side.

It was pretty good. We avoided the inside due to the fact of its tight tables and nightlife appearance and opted for a high table outside. It was nice. As usual we ordered Miso soup, Edamame and four  rolls. I had the rainbow and the fish was pretty good with the exception of the shrimp, too chewy for my liking. My boyfriend had a mango roll and shrimp tempura and a orange chicken. He was pleased with all three. We might go again, as long as they have outside seating. Their happy hour kind of sucks but good for people who enjoy drinking.

9/3
Walked in ten minutes before 6p.  Just in time to order a few apps during happy hour!  However, half-priced happy hour apps and beverages were very limited in number and marked with smiley faces, and they were so hard to spot on the menu!  Perhaps having only ten minutes to hunt them down exacerbated my difficulty of spotting them, but I hope the managers consider having separate easy-to-read menus printed and used.  Liked that martini-drinkers have many martinis to select from.
Tried a couple of rolls, but I can't recall much to write about except that I would probably come back to try other apps and entrees not on the HH menu, but I'm in no hurry to go back.
We are here tonight for my daughters 15th birthday!!! The family can count on awesome service, great food, and a celebration for all!!  We love that Gilbert has such a great sushi restaurant
Great food and the service was really good! And the atmosphere is awesome! Go for happy hour, because the drinks are so fun and unique!! So very yummy!!

Dinner with my family started out enjoyable enough. The food was rather mediocre, though I wasn't expecting much being far from any sources of fresh fish, or Japanese cooks. I also decided to steer clear of the blue wasabi that looks like it's been dipped in anti-freeze. It was obvious their focus was not on food, but on drinks and creating a fun atmosphere. Their decor is hip and contemporary, with a color changing wall above the bar, and abundant flashing lights and TV screens. They try to continue the theme by naming their signature sushi rolls with silly names like "Eating Nemo" or  "Kiss My Bass", though a few like  "Me Soy Horny Roll" or "Dirty Sanchez" hardly make you think of sushi. Despite the second rate food and the epilepsy inducing environment, hanging out with your 4 yr old nephew is always a good time...or so I thought.

Close to the resolution of dinner, I took a break to smoke a joint behind the restaurant. I'm from Cali, so...I was being a bit nonchalant and careless about it all, not realizing the laws here are a bit different. I was just chatting on the phone with my girlfriend while trying to mind my own business. A girl from Blue Wasabi who was also hanging out in back of the restaurant smelled it, and asked me to "please move on"...I replied "Sorry! I didn't realize I was disturbing anyone, thanks for telling me nicely." And I put it out and returned to my table.

10 minutes later the cops are hauling me out in front of my parents and little nephew. 5 minutes later I'm in cuffs and they're charging me with a class 6 felony.

Wow...I couldnt believe it. This girl, even described me as "nice" to the cops, yet she called the cops on me as I peacefully patronize her restaurant with my family! Does she have no heart? What a cruel and unnecessary thing to do! Things like this make me lose faith in humanity. Why would someone wish such terrible treatment upon a fellow human for no good reason? It makes me deeply sad. 

I can't in good faith recommend a restaurant where they treat their customers like criminals, literally.

I took my daughter to Blue Wasabi for a special time for us. Our waitress was nice and they were running a Sunday special that  gives 1/2 price off all alcohol drinks for the day. I ordered a raspberry lemonade for myself and Shirley Temple for my daughter. For sushi - a shrimp tempura roll, spicy tuna, and tuna avocado. When I checked into the restaurant, a coupon came up for buy 3 rolls and get the 4th free. We ordered a spicy crab roll as well. The rolls were okay. Spicy seemed less Japanese spiciness and more American tabasco drenched. 

When I received the check, I was surprised when my martini was full priced and asked my waitress who asked the manager. He informed me that since I used the buy
3, get 4th free promo my alcohol would be full price. I explained to him that I was never told this and I wouldn't have gotten the 4th roll if I had known and he pretty much gave me the "sol" speech with no attempt to throw in a dose of customer service. I let it go because I didn't want to upset my daughter but when you're food is just okay then your customer service should really make up for it. Sure it was just $5 more to my bill but the fact that I won't be returning with my seven person foodie family will cost him a lot more.

Blue Wasabi San Tan

I bellied up to the bar here and was immediately greeted by a smiling happy bartender. Very nice gal (From Tampa Florida) and she handed me a menu and explained about the happy hour special. I perused the menu and was shocked at the happy hour value. Kirin Light 'biggies' for 3 bucks and add a jumbo size Sake for a buck and a  1/2 - are you kidding me. I sat near the service well and the bartender would give me "tasters" from the excess in the shaker of all the colorful martinis she was making. Great stuff. 

I ordered 4 items to eat. BBQ Drunken Shrimp, Chicken Skewers, White Tuna Sashimi, and Cajun Tuna Sashimi. 

BBQ Drunken Shrimp - great looking item. A jumble of marinated shrimp cooked perfectly on a platter of thin tangy BBQ sauce. Served with some nice toast points to soak up the delicious sauce. 

Chicken Skewers - item was satisfactory. It had a nice presentation however it wasn't chicken breast but rather darker chicken that was cut and skewered on sections on to the stick. It had a nice sauce and was accompanied by a ramekin of dried chilis and powdered chili pepper and tasted fine. Only issue again was the non white meat. 

White Tuna Sashimi - my least favorite of the four. The meat was cut a bit to thin; however, was fresh. The orange and ginger sauce was near non-existent. Not terrible item but not real memorable either. 

Cajun Tuna Sashimi - Awesome item. Good quality cut of fished seared perfectly on the outside and sliced ruby red on the inside. Fanned out on the plate it looked great. Only issue was that the sauce was good but not enough of it. Real bargain for six bucks. 

My friendly neighbors at the bar ordered the appetizer mushrooms which looked fantastic and I will definitely try them next time. 

Great Service - Great Ambiance - Great Food

Blue Wasabi has become my new favorite sushi joint in town! A very hip, trendy, sushi bar with young, fun servers. I was never a sushi fan, but always loved the idea of "going out to sushi". With that said, it's very important to me that a sushi restaurant offers a variety of non-seafood menu items. I had The Clucker and The Bada Bing both wrapped in soy paper and they were both amazing! We heard that Sundays were 1/2 alcoholic beverages if you wore a blue shirt, so after church we actually drove home and changed our shirts before going but when we got there, we heard the server offer the special to our neighboring table who weren't wearing blue? It was a great experience and we will definitely be going back!

I had a fantastic time here this evening. I came during happy hour and tried the California roll and Garden Gecko. I thought since it was tempura shrimp and seared tuna it would count as me being adventurous with sushi. I texted Andrea K. and she confirmed no, that doesn't count. Still - it was good and thet drink prices at happy hour were excellent. Just go with things that have a smiley face and they are half price until 6. 

The waitress, Heather took good care of us - and soon my attention turned to sake. A gecko roll, California roll, 2 Kiren Ichibans and 2 caraffes of sake - $23. Nice! Heather was very cool and had a most excellent tattoo. She was even friendly after we walked back to the car after being tossed from Gordon Biersch. What a cool waitress. She let us sit for a long time and continued to wait on us. I would come back here any time for happy hour.

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!! I have loved Blue Wasabi ever since it first started in DC Ranch over 10 years ago and expanded into central Scottsdale with its second location. Now the location in Gilbert is the only one left and it's obvious why! We went here a couple weeks ago and we're even more disappointed than the last time which we thought was a fluke. We always order a ton of different dishes but our surf and turfs were the biggest disappointment. They gave us raw steak on top of the roll when it's supposed to be seared. We asked her to please take the dish back and have it prepared medium rare to medium. We watched the waitress give it to the sushi cook and watched him make faces and jokes in front of staff and customers. He then took out a blowtorch and just tried cooking the steak that way. When it came to the table it smelled and tasted like gas. We informed the waitress once again and asked her to take the dish back. It was met with more attitude and not once did a manager come over and apologize or ask about it. The service and quality of food have gone way down hill. We drive from the north side of the valley, so we won't be returning anytime soon!!

I expected a lot from this restaurant because I've heard great things about this restaurant from family living in the area. We ordered a couple of rolls ( I can't remember which ones though!) and the one I got was the spicy tuna. I thought it was good and the presentation was nice. The service was a bit slow, but it was a busy night. Our waiter was extremely nice and apologized for the delay, but it was a great first time experience at Blue Wasabi!
Delicious!! Loved everything except ironically the soda... My husband and I have had sprite and root beer from here and it had the weirdest aftertaste... Sushi is bomb though!

Sushi is probably my favorite food.  And this is my favorite sushi place in Phoenix.  (Sorry, the very best is in San Francisco).  Great food, excellent drinks, and a lively atmosphere make this place one of my favorite hang outs.  The staff is also pretty chill and seems to deal pretty well with the rush.  Having waited tables at two busy bars, I truly appreciate this.

Good sushi fills me up. My husband and I left this place hungry. We walked across the street to Paradise Bakery for a sandwich afterwards. (wah wah) 

We got the fried crab wontons to start. They were served with applesauce...odd combination. We got the squid, spicy tuna and yellowtail rolls. The sushi was SO SMALL!!! Sushi is supposed to be bite-sized, but these were microscopic. Rip-off for the price we paid. 

The sushi rice was a little warm (gross) and the seaweed wrap was chewier than it should have been. 

I understand the restaurant is trying to be innovative with the dark blue wasabi, but I prefer the traditional green. I mix green wasabi with soy sauce to get the perfect shade of brown and gauge the intensity level. The soy sauce doesn't change with the blue wasabi, so good luck guessing!
Super fun and creative restaurant! Fun items, and cool ambiance. Great for a weekend night with friends

I love sushi I would say it's my favorite food. I think  this restaurant is trying to put a spin on sushi and it's just not my style. Also I think it's not worth the price of the rolls. Martini's were delicious.

Not a bad place if your in Gilbert.  While the prices can be on the higher side I've always had a pleasant experience here.  They have a good happy hour. Lots of different flavored Martinis. And the sushi isn't bad.  My favorites are the Wango Mango and the Topic Thunder.  You definitely need to try those if you haven't. 

If you looking for a cool place to have a few that has more of an adult feel then this is your place.  Not the best sushi in AZ, but for Gilbert your inky other choice is Ra or Kona.  Pick your poison.   

I choose Blue Wasabi.

Great food and drinks! I love the Spicy Tuna Roll so good!! I get it every time, does have alittle kick to it so if you like spicy then this is for you! As far a the Martinis I love the Lemon Raspberry Ice and Milky Way! Great atmosphere and nice employees :)

By far the best martinis on the planet!!! They had me at orange Julius martini. Took me back to my childhood when I used to get them at the mall but better because of vodka, LOL. The Milky Way martini is also delicious and I highly recommend it. I'm not a sushi person at all so I really appreciate they have appetizers on the menu like mini sliders w/ fries and southwest egg rolls that are also yummy. Love this place!! I hate I moved out of Phoenix. I haven't found a place like this anywhere else. I always make a point to come here whenever I'm in town.

Blue Wasabi is much like other trendy sushi places with it's ambiance. But they have a good variety of specialty rolls and drinks. I love their blue-colored wasabi! If you're in the area, Blue Wasabi has something for everyone, whether it's with friends, family, or on a date. I think it's cool and my parents certainly like it. They have TVs for Sunday football (for the sports enthusiast, like my stepdad) and they're located in one of the prettier outdoor malls, Santan Village, in Gilbert (for people like me and my mom who love to shop). The prices aren't bad - seems like the norm for this type of "hip" restaurant. And you'll crack up when you read the names of their rolls. I honestly can't think of anything negative to say because the sushi is good and the staff are friendly, attentive and quick. Keep the sake coming and you'll have a good time!
Great location and great sushi rolls.  Sundays are half off all drinks.  I will miss this place when I move out of Gilbert.  This is the last location in AZ.  Great atmosphere and great staff.

Wow! Did we enjoy ourselves! Nice atmosphere. Convenient location. Friendly staff. All great things, but nothing compares to the incredible variety and deliciousness of the menu! Their house specialty sushi rolls are unique combinations and everyone we tried was a winner! 3 of us finished off 6 rolls - including every smidge of the sauces!

I'd love to give them 4-5 stars but the service lately had been horrible. The food and drinks are good and consistent, and good happy hour. Service gets worse every visit. We waited 25 minutes to order food and get water while our waitress stood in the corner flirting with another waiter-- and they were slammed.

The in-laws were in town and wanted to treat us to Sushi. Super busy Friday night and we didn't have a reservation. What were we thinking?!
The wait was a good hour. I could see why as we were seated. The service was great and the sushi was fantastic! Who would want to give up their table?! 
We went for several special rolls including the Marilyn Monroll and the Surf and Turf along with some of our favorite traditional rolls like Philly roll and tuna roll. Simply amazing! 
We plan to return. Heck, the In-laws were still raving about it days later!

Well... we came here for their happy hour. Great deals between 4-6pm on Happy Hour days. A variety of martinis are $5. As you can see  they're a large size and tasted great. Sake combos were $6.75 and lasted 3 to 4 bombs. They even let you hit the table with chopsticks to drop it... but it was getting really messy so we stopped that.

The food was pretty good. I don't like sushi so we got some chicken which was tasty. The sushi all looked good and appeared to be made fresh when ordered. They deliver things as they finish, so food was just randomly arriving which was kind of weird but it all got there. 

After food we continued doing saki bombs... and let's just say I'm not really sure what happened after that. Haha 

Overall, we had a good time here. Their happy hour deal was well worth it giving large martinis and plenty of saki. The food was good, however the delivery timing was random so waiting for everyone to get their stuff would have been awful. Service was nice and the place was pretty busy the whole time we were there. I'd come for another happy hour once I recover from this one...

I went here with my boyfriend yesterday because of the reviews on Yelp and we were both really disappointed. 

The atmosphere is very club like- if you're into that sort of thing then it's something that won't bother you. But, it definitely wasn't my kind of ambiance. It seems like a place that should be on Mill Ave. Really you are paying for the atmosphere of a club-like environment, not the food. 

The food was terrible. It was really bland, hardly any taste to anything we ordered, even the sushi rolls that were supposed to be spicy were still tasteless. Even the avocado on our rolls tasted like nothing. 

I went expecting the same kind of food as RA, but RA is so much better. I would rather pay RA's full price menu than eat at Blue Wasabi for happy hour. This place is not even worth trying- it was a waste of 20 bucks.

It's a love hate thing -- I don't eat much sushi, but I can't help when everyone else does.  So I generally end up at a sushi joint.  I can say as a non-sushi eating person - I enjoyed Blue Wasabi.  I think it's the "blue wasabi" that makes it so special.  Drinks here are a tad bit pricey, but I've never been here for happy hour nor "Special Blue Days" -- I guess if you wear a blue shirt on certain days; you get a discount -- makes sense.  Service is okay, but shouldn't their uniforms be blue?  Maybe the Blue Sailor Moon!!?? Wow I got an idea! :) - Enjoy!

I had an amazing experience at your restaurant this week.  The restaurant environment was extremely enjoyable.  I would definitely revisit Blue Wasabi. Blue Wasabi is a place that anyone can go to, its not just for certain type of people. if you haven't tried sushi, or afraid to try it you should start here. 

I visited Blue Wasabi this week and enjoyed their different versions of the traditional rolls that you can find a lot of places, they also have different rolls you can't find anywhere else. The wait staff was friendly, and on top of their work at all times. The lighting was set at the perfect level, and I really enjoyed their decorations as well.  The wait wasn't long at all, even on a busy Friday night. Popular restaurant, in a popular place, full of an amazing food and people. 

If there was anything I could change it would be the prices, it was a little pricey and some would think that it's not worth it. Other than that it is a great restaurant and a lot of places should take notes.

I was expecting good sushi.... and I was not disappointed!  We had martini's, sushi and dessert.  I recommend the Magic Mike martini and the Kaboom and PITA roll.  Thanks to our server Cathy.  She was attentive and offered excellent suggestions. We'll definitely be back !!
the only time to go there is for happy hour. otherwise, it's overpriced for average sushi fare...

SanTan Village is quickly becoming 'Scottsdale East' as The Blue Wasabi Sushi and Martini Bar adds another trendy, upscale restaurant to its list of tenants. 

At first glance at the name, I didn't think Sushi and Martinis was a good mix but after taking my wife there on a 'date night', I'm a believer. We're both hooked on this place. We enjoyed everything we tried. My wife especially like their use of soy wrappers instead of seaweed in some of their signature rolls. Some of our favs are the MARILYN MONROLL, RED HOT CHILLI PEPPER ROLL, and the ME SO HORNEY ROLL.  We haven't tried them all yet - but we intend to. 

One thing to note, I would stress the 'BAR' in the name of this establishment, as, at least during the weekends, the Martinis flow and it can get loud in there - I would call it a 'Fun, Adult Atmosphere' - one we enjoyed without the kids. 

Another plus, as crowed and busy as it gets, we have always been pleased with the service. On our last visit, our server,  Tara, turned us on to some great new dishes and some incredible drinks. For me, when a server takes the time to help make your experience enjoyable, even when their 'bouncing off the walls' busy, that's exceptional - And I think this is the first time I've ever remembered my servers name so that's gotta say something.
