So, it's trendy, got good eats, good drinks, fun atmosphere, and super service, so why just 4 stars? Price, when a couple slices of raw fish can run as much as a prime rib dinner, that's a bit steep. Wash it down with a few $10 martinis and your looking at a pretty pricey evening. Nonetheless, were hooked.
The sashimi is not fresh, the filet minion skewers are not tasty, gamy. The service is good. But the food is terrible. Glasses aren't clean. Just terrible food
Fun atmosphere, good sushi, creative rolls. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. Always have a great time & enjoy the food, but it's always cost me. The bill ads up quickly!

Great atmosphere. Love the setting, and the service is great. Employees are very understanding. I had to send my order back because I forgot to tell him I was allergic to avocado and they had no problem, but other than that it's up there with the most tasteless rolls I've ever had :/ the blue wasabi tastes funky and ginger is way too pink. Too much food coloring if you ask me.
Overpriced, crowded, loud and sushi rolls are on the small side especially for the price. Food was ok but for the price, crowd, and noise not worth it.

I've tried this place 3 times now, and well, it just doesn't live up to its hype.   It is trendy, clean, decorated nicely, located strategically, and the service is good.   But for me, the food is just "eh ok", the special martinis are just "eh ok", and its pricey.

The atmosphere was great in the play sitting outside with the heaters on however I must say that had to be the most Bland and tasteless Sushi I've ever had and I am not trying to be high maintenance. I probably will not be coming back there the prices weren't even that great either. Sadly because I really wanted to like a place despite the bad reviews

ONLY go during Happy Hour. For 2 small apps, one traditional sushi roll, shrimp and crab dynamite, 2 half off martinis (Tues ladies night) and 2 beers, our total was $60, $72 with tip. YOU have to be kidding me. I think that's insane. We could have done a comedy club with 2 drink min for the same price or pretty much anything else that night. NOT WORTH THE PRICE. ONLY go here if you can make it for happy hour. The only positive is that happy hour starts pretty early...around 4 or 4:30pm.

This was our first time at Blue Wasabi. I love sushi; it is my absolute favorite food, and trust me, I've had a lot in my lifetime.

When we walked it, it was a nice-looking ambiance. I love black with blue lighting. It reminded me of another trendy sushi place, Ra Sushi, and my experience at Ra wasn't too bad. So we sat down, excited for some good food!

The menu was interesting. Lots of trendy names. However, it was a lot to take in at once. My friends and I agreed that it would have been less overwhelming if the menu had been perhaps organized better, perhaps into categories like soy wrapping, main types of fish, or some form of organization for the rolls. I got tired of reading everything pretty quickly. 

Warning: if you want iced green (matcha) tea, they don't have it. Our server didn't tell us anything in fact. Nothing about it being ladies night (50% martinis) or that they didn't have an iced green tea. She just simply brought over a pot of green tea and a glass with ice. I was a bit baffled. Had I said it wrong? Had she misheard me? So I looked at the menu - yes, I should have looked at the menu before ordering my drink, but it's such a staple in sushi and Japanese restaurants that I hadn't even thought to look. And she had not bothered to let me know that they do not have a separate iced green tea. She was nice about it though, and I ordered the dessert blossom black tea instead, which was delicious. 

Now, for the food... So, blue wasabi. I felt like I was looking at play-doh when they first brought it out. But I figured, I'll just eat it. It's cute. I took pictures. But then... The blue just muddled my sushi. I was confused looking at it, because I felt like I was supposed to be eating a blueberry juice or smoothie from the color it stained my food. But it was wasabi. It was just so odd. And when you dip your nigiri, you dip it on the fish side. When I lifted my sushi up after dipping, we all looked at it in horror. It looked pretty disgusting, and my friend joked that he had projectile vomited all over it while I wasn't looking. Very unpleasant. I had to eat the whole time, avoiding to look at it.

As for the food itself? Meh. Nothing spectacular. The nigiri was actually warm and not the best quality. For the price, I expected much better. We also go some rolls including the Tail-er Swift and the Marilyn after reading some comments on yelp.

The Tail-er Swift had this layer of wonton inside. It had this unpleasant bite.. Like someone had left some stale hard crackers and decided to put them in. The taste itself wasn't bad, but again, the fish was warm! The Marilyn had a soy wrapper, and actually it was the better of the options for me, both in terms of taste and texture. But again, not quite worth the price. 

Service - pretty abysmal as well. She had not told us about the specials, she had brought over the hot green tea with ice without telling us, never refilled our drinks, and to top it off - she spilled some soy sauce from a plate all over my friend. No apology. To be fair, I am not sure if she noticed, but she still was not careful. You just don't lift a pile of plates that high and put plates over them that roughly, while standing right over you customer. That was just the final straw. Horrible experience.

I wanted to like this place. I REALLY REALLY wanted to. But the only good thing about the experience was my dessert blossom iced tea. The food, the prices, the quality, and the service were pretty bad.

I looked to the table next to us during dinner and realized they had only gotten drinks. Maybe that's what this place is really for - some drinks with a few munchies if you get hungry. I just don't see myself coming back here for a full meal again. Maybe I'll try happy hour at some point. But I wouldn't go out of my way to go there, even for that. So sad to be disappointed. :(

my wife and I loved the food here!

We went just after happy hour on a Friday night. So it was pretty busy, but a perfect time of year for sitting outside. I would NOT want to sit inside though, it is a giant LOUD echo chamber in there - think 100 people in a bathroom with loud music and you get the idea....

Here is the food we had and review:

SPICY YELLOWTAIL TEMPURA MUSHROOMS: Outstanding!!!!!
CRAB WONTONS: Very good
WANGO MANGO: excellent!!
SUMMER LOVIN: very good

Service was average. Our waitress was not very friendly and seemed flustered and always hurried. But did not make any food mistakes at least...

Overall, we really enjoyed this place and found the sushi/food to be excellent.

Last night I went to Blue Wasabi for the second time in the week. I am a new fan. We went at 4pm when Happy Hour started and boy did we have fun. We sat outside on the patio and my group of 4 only ordered 'Happy Hour' items off both the food and martini menu, but we ordered alot. The martinis at Blue Wasabi are top notch, I ordered a Lemon Drop martini, the Mowie Wowie, and the "Milky Way" which tastes just like the candy bar and comes in a caramel dipped martini glass. Yum! The great thing about Blue Wasabi is they have more than just sushi on the menu, so if you're not in the mood for seafood, there are other items to try. For instance my companions ordered the Macadamia Chicken Strips which came with a sweet n sour sauce, and we ordered the 'Fowl Play" which had Grilled and chilled chicken and wrapped like sushi. Both items were perfect to taste. We also ordered many seafood items such as the 'MARILYN MONROLL' one of our favorites and we love the presentation of it but our new favorite by far is the 'WANGO MANGO ROLL" it tastes so different but is AMAZING! You must try it. We are still trying to figure out if the Blue Wasabi is made blue with food coloring or if it is actually a different kind of wasabi. It tastes a lil lighter than the traditional green wasabi. Our waiter Chris is one of the best waiters in Phoenix, he remembered us from last time and gave us top notch service, he is attentive without being intrusive. We were there for HOURS last night and some in our party got a lil tipsy off all the martini's but we had a great time without breaking the bank cause we left right after Happy Hour ended. ;-)

Great sushi and even better martinis.  Located in DC Ranch, Blue Wasabi is a small but cute little place with a nice patio out front.  The sushi rolls are...uhm creative to say the least and have names like the dirty sanchez for one example, 
The martinis are fantastic- I tried one made with Pama and it was amazing. They have tons of specialty martinis on their menu for you to choose from and service is usually pretty fast. 
This is a great place to go out for happy hour because you can always hit one of the other bars in DC Ranch after if you feel like going out.
Loud over priced and not worth the hassle. Waiters were surly and service was slow. Drinks were cute but expensive. Don't bother.

This is the best place ever for some good old happy hour. I only come here for the happy hour though because it has spoiled me and I refuse to pay anything but half price for these delicious rolls. Don't worry, happy hour happens frequently. The best part? Happy hour is on Saturdays too!!! They have a ton of rolls, appetizers, meals, drinks for half off. Sometimes there is a wait, but this is definitely worth it. Every roll I had here was great. The best ones are eating nemo and dirty sanchez. The names of these rolls are pretty comical, but once you take a bite, you wont be laughing. Enjoy!

This is the climax of the "wanna-be, uber-cool, all flash no substance sushi chair".  Everything is overpriced. The food and drinks are standard at beat. Service is unimpressive. There are so many good authentic sushi returants that are owned by families that you should try before this corporate cafeteria. Oh and the tables are terrible also.

An upscale Japanese fusion restaurant in the San Tan Mall area. Great bar, especially for mixed cocktails. I've been there a couple of times during "happy hour", and was not disappointed. They have a wide assortment of sushi at "happy hour" prices.

We've been to Blue Wasabi several times, in groups big and small.  It's always a hit.  The sushi is not the best I've ever had but it's solid...no complaints here.  

For drinks I recommend their sparkling sake.  When I heard about it I was a bit skeptical but it's really good!  You can find it at Bevmo, by the way...just can't remember the name right now.

If you can get past the freaky blue wasabi that does look like playdough (as someone else here said) you have to try the following:

-Ahi Tuna Poke - so fresh and yummy
-Seared Yellowtail with jalapeno sauce - a bit of a kick

The special rolls are good too.  I'll never forget the Marilyn Monroll.  You have to try it just to say the name!

We never have a real problem finding a table here.  It does get crowded but it's not unbearable.  And they have heaters outside so it's actually a nice spot in the winter.  You know, the one month when it gets cold in Phoenix.

Enjoy!
Big fan of sushi and sushimi. Quality fish, but you pay for the atmoshere. Catch them at happy hour and go to town!

I have lived near Blue Wasabi for over two years and decided to pop in one day when I had a craving for sushi.
Lucky for my boyfriend and I, we happened to go during happy hour and the deals were great! We tried a variety of the sushi rolls and all around were pretty impressed. 
The sushi was fresh, but some of the flavors did not mesh well for my taste. 
The hot edamame was great! I couldn't stop eating the little pods, even after the sushi was served.
My only gripe was the waiter seemed to be on another land. For about fifteen minutes I went without a drink and finally walked up to another waiter and requested she help me find the waiter or water- whichever would be faster. Even after the waiter realized we were guzzling water, he seemed to be distracted by something else. As soon as the sushi was served we were handed our ticket as well, despite the place not being busy. That never sits well with me. . . but I suppose in retrospect it was good or we would have waited a while for that as well.
All-in-all if I am around the area and crave sushi  I will go. It seems like they have great alcoholic drinks, so I am curious to see about their happy hour solely focused on the drinks. 
Will try again and hope to not get the same waiter.
This place is amazing !! The staff is the best there is  Stefan has the best recommendations !!

Service was a bit slow (especially for a Saturday night around 10... It was pretty dead). The specialty rolls were awesome and had cutesy names. Also, the combinations were very unique! I highly recommend the Marco Rollo and Surf & Turf rolls. Cautionary advice: the wasabi at Blue Wasabi is actually blue (imagine that), but it stinks of dye and preservatives & tastes gross... AVOID!

My husband and I had amazing sushi and martinis from here. I had a pineapple martini which was surprisingly so fresh and delicious. We definitely will be going back for date nights. Also, the customer service was great.

Well I think to some up our experience I will leave you with this one brief sentence:

My daughter poured out some soy sauce to dip her sushi in and a dead fly came out of the soy sauce jar.  Enough said.....

This is by far my favorite sushi spot ive found in the valley  (aside from higher end places).  The shrimp tempura inside the rolls are actually crispy and all the sushi is well balanced. My only complaint is That I live in Biltmore and can not go every week :/
I have visited this location in two occasions and both times the rolls have been very good. Creative cuisine. Drinks are always great and the service is prompt and attentive.  I recommend it!
Best sushi place I've ever ate at other than a tropical island. Make sure to end the night with a berry white martini and the rainbow roll dessert.

Great place to chill with friends. Me and my husband always get the dam jumper and the kaboom! You will not be disappointed. It did however take us a couple of times to find what we like because there sushi is so unique.

Dry sushi and quite bland.

Edamame was undercooked by a long shot.

Orange Chicken had tons of Orange Peel and little chicken.

Not good!

This is my favorite sushi place ever. I live in Scottsdale and I make the hour and fifteen minute drive at least 2 times a month. The wango mango roll is amazing! I also get the mi soy horny and Krusty krab. You must try this place. Places like RA don't even begin to compare to the atmosphere, customer service, and food at blue wasabi.

I really enjoy the diverse menu, freshness and well-prepared food that hits the table, quality table service, and variety of drinks. The price is a little spendy, but this isn't a place most go frequently anyway. I've had a pretty good experience with the service being very good at the table, though drink and food has been slow to arrive to the table. When the food starts coming, it often is well-paced. (I typically go here with 4-6 and we share a number of plates.)
Food was solid here prices a bit on the high end but tuna was fresh . They need to add some beers on draft and they would of had my 5 star review

Nestled between the pizza joint and the swanky seafood restaurant off Market St., Blue Wasabi rocks my world. Tiny, tiny, little place. More room on the patio than inside. The everchanging colored panels behind the bar may make your head spin, if like me, you indulge in their fabulous martinis. The rolls are inventive and dee lish. I like the surf and turf with filet mignon and lobster tempura...omg...I'm crying now just thinking of it. The calamari salad is also a must have. The crowd is oh-so North Scottsdale. Lots of white, blond people and a sea of silicon. And I'm talking about the guys! I was a regular here when I lived at DC Ranch, kinda far from my Central Phoenix digs. I think Sundays, if you wear blue, you get half off. If you don't wear blue, they charge you double. No, just kidding. It's worth the drive for the food and fab patio, views of McDowell Mountains. The crowd, however, kinda vacuous and pretentious. Yikes! Origato Yelpers!

Yelpers didn't let me down!

When my girlfriend suggested we head to this place for a little sushi, I immediately did a little research and was pleased to see what great ratings were earned.  I also did a little research online.

Since it was Sunday, we wore blue and got 50% off our drinks.  Cute concept!

Blue wasabi...heheh...genius.  It looked like play-doh....

The plethora of unique martinis made me spin with confusion until I asked our nice waiter.  He recommended the Lemon Rasperry Ice.  A little sweet, a little sour, a lot of Mmmm!  It's mighty dangerous however, since you can't really taste the liquor....unfortunately, my genes make me turn a little crimson when I get a little alkihawl...so as a human alcohol beacon, I could tell it was definitely potent.  No watering down here!

The sushi menu has traditional items on one side (boring) and inventive fusionistic items on the other (why not?)....so of course we turned to the dark side.

Killer Bee made sense when I saw it plated.  And as an eel lover, I savored every sweet and succulent piece that tickled my tongue.  It's my new favorite.

I can't even remember the other rolls we tried, I keep thinking of that Bee.  But I do know they didn't leave a bad taste in my mouth.

Cool blue ambience
Neat bathroom sink fixtures (I notice those wierd things)
Cushy blue seats
Mondrian-esque blue background behind the bar
$9 Martinis that went to $4.50 for wearing blue

Definitely a must do again!
Love the wango mango roll and butta face martini. Lots of great things on the menu! A little pricy but happy hour is good!! One of my favorite places.cant wait to go again!

I eat here fairly often. I like the sushi (a lot more than the Kona next door. At kona, it's always super fishy). This place is a modern, hip environment. The servers aren't super nice - they give you basic service and just leave you alone. Which some people like and some people don't. I personally like it, as long as my food is hot & out in a decent amount of time & my drink is full.. I'm happy. I don't need small talk from a waitress. 

The Martinis are good but expensive. Happy Hour is the best time to visit - but the staff moves slow on purpose to limit the stuff you can get. 

Overall I like this place - but it's for a certain type of customer. Get the crab wontons, and the mango wango.

10 people working behind the sushi bar, and three patrons at the sushi bar. We had to ask for a menu, the guy just kinda threw it at us and left. Got our tab and left. The service sucked. My first and last time here.
The sushi was not to bad, I got the "yo adrian" However the happy hour prices even on a Saturday  was a great deal. The pork dumplings were nice.

Blue Wasabi is amazing. They have the greatest service, they were all so friendly. They were so fast at taking our order and bringing the food out. The sushi tasted delightful, I love going to this place. It has a very nice atmosphere and you always leave feeling happy.
Great food! Great service! Awesome martinis!  I love that they have traditional sushi and cooked options. I LOVE the Get Clucked. Delicious!

We drove over 50 miles one way to satisfy our sushi cravings.  We were not disappointed. The food is stellar & the service excellent.  The sushi is always fresh & melt in your mouth delish.  We ordered the other wasabi paste diced and prepare for some fire! The ice cold Kirin beers were appreciated!  
The owner Jim is always there, working along with his wonderfully trained staff, overseeing & making the patrons feel welcome & special.
We love this place and only wish it were closer!

Well, their happy hour ends at 6:00 but it is a pretty good happy hour.  Half off some of their cocktails, wine and what not and half of some rolls and other apps.  What gets me is the wasabi is actually blue.  Yes, that's the name and all but do we really need to be so contrived as to actually load up the patrons with Blue No. 1 and 2 (maybe a touch of Green No. 3)?  That just grossed me out to no end.  The intensity of the color still disturbs me.  Their second strike is the name of their rolls.  Really, I want something presented to me as the "Dirty Sanchez" and the "Me Soy Horney"?  They all tasted fine but the names alone did them in.  We won't be back.  I had been to the location in North Scottsdale probably four years ago but it was after wine tasting and we were all wasted so maybe that's the key to a good meal here.  Complete obliteration.

This is my first time here and WOW it was awesome. Service was great and the sushi is top notch. Great drink menu with large vodka menu. We'll be back again for sure. Oh yeah, Happy Hour is a great deal too!  Half price drinks and rolls!

i finally tried this place yesterday with a friend and I don't get the hype.I have had a lot of sushi in my life so forgive me if I might be too harsh. 

i got the "get clucked" roll and my friend got the "dam jumper" roll.  First off, the portions were tiny! When the dinky rolls came out, my friend and I both gave each other a knowing look. My poor friend is a big guy and he just looked downright sad. (We got burgers after thankfully). Second, the rice was soggy and mushy. Really unappetizing. The get clucked roll was doused in sweet and sour sauce which only made the mushy-ness of the rice worse.

I can't speak much about the dam jumper roll because I didn't try it other than to say it was depressingly small. 

On the up side, the service was great. Extremely attentive, helpful, friendly. Everything you could ask for. The ambiance is nice: clean, modern, with an ipad on the table to order and a huge projector screen. For these reasons, I couldn't give the place only 1 star (but come on... this is based on food right?)

BEST MARTINIS. Some of their drinks are better than dessert; order a dessert drink like "buttaface" instead of dessert and you'll be happy. Well, I always am.

The food is really good - we always get the garlic edamame. It's spicy. I like spicy so it's good for me- don't order it if you aren't committed. Crab wontons with plum sauce are worth getting. We even had their street tacos - odd for a sushi place - but they were awesome! We are picky about our tacos so I didn't think they had a chance. I've had sushi here and I think I remember it being good. 

The experience is always good for me and whoever I go there with. The waiters are friendly and I've never had a problem. 

Overall, we like coming here. My husband and I save this place for a back-up place to go if we are trying somewhere new for their cocktails. At least we know we'll get something we like by the end of the night!
Staff is excellent, beer and wine selection is ok. Roll selection is great, me soy horny, chuck Norris and tropic thunder are good!!

"Summer Love, Chuck Norris, Eating Nemo and Yo Adrian" - These are some of the clever and fun sushi rolls offered at Blue Wasabi! 

If you're looking for clever, unique and creative sushi - this is the place to be! Blue Wasabi has a cool vibe, making you feel like your at a bar under the sea. On top of the chill atmosphere (which includes large flat screens and projectors for any sports game you may be interested in) it also provides a wide selection of sushi rolls and martinis. 

Everything my party had was delicious, we enjoyed all the different rolls and martinis we had. I would rate this location with 5 stars but 1, 2, 6 drinks and rolls later and you can be spending a pretty penny here. Blue Wasabi has an expensive price attached, if I could provide any advice, come during happy hour - you've been warned!

We went here for happy hour. I got the "oh me soy horny" roll, it had Shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, cucumber and avocado wrapped in soy paper. This has been by far my favorite roll I have ever tried. I had my daughter with me this day so I also got some orange chicken. This was a lil dry on the inside and didnt have too much flavor. My sister had the chuck norris roll, it had Spicy salmon and panko crusted shrimp inside, topped with sashimi salmon, avocado,
fresh squeezed lemon juice and togarashi. She said hers was very tasty as well. We went here during happy hour. Our total bill was $30.00, this included 2 cocktails, 2 different rolls, orange chicken and another appetizer. I liked the happy hour alot, good prices and good vibe. This place is packed during happy hour but well worth the wait. I also been hearing that ther is an ipad at your table to order. I didnt see this anywhere so not sure if they no longer do or is this just at certain times?

I was visiting from Los Angeles and my friend who lives in the area wanted to have a belated celebratory birthday dinner for us both at Blue Wasabi. Her & her husband love this place and she raved about their food. Good sushi & great company? I'm all about it... We arrived around 7pm and I was dropped off out front in hopes of securing a table for 6 on a busy Friday night. They only had room for 6 at the long communal table in the center of the main room but I wanted our party to have a table of our own. A manager stepped in and said they just had to clear out a table and we would be seated. Im pleased to say we were seated in less than 5 mins. Excellent.

Blue Wasabi has a very modern vibe from the not-so-typical heat lamps outside in the dining patio to the color changing backdrop behind the sushi bar and the high chairs & tables we were seated on. Very blue from the seat upholstery, staff shirts and even the plate our unagi was served on. Oh and I cant forget the wasabi was actually blue. I'm somewhat of a purist but I was game. I liked that they changed it up a bit. It's definitely unique. 

We started off with the spicy rockin shrimp tempura ($14.50). This was so good. It's served warm, crispy, sitting in a lettuce cup inside a martini glass. The shrimp was crispy on the outside, tasted fresh and lathered in a slightly spicy mayo. This dish is a star... And we subsequently asked our excellent waitress Kathy to bring 2 additional orders of this deliciousness. As soon as they brought one to the table, our party inhaled it. Order it. Dont even think twice.

Others things we ordered were: the unagi (fresh water eel) sashimi plate ($11.25). I love eel & this unagi order had generous slices of the goodness drizzled with the requisite eel sauce. I liked it... Next up was the crispy spicy tuna ($10). This was excellent. I even had to let the manager know that the way they served it up (still warm) was the key to enjoying this dish fully. The crispy rice makes it... with the spicy tuna, jalapeno slice, cilantro and drizzled in sauce. I also let the manager know that they executed this dish far better than the famed Katsuya restaurants in Los Angeles whose signature appetizer is the crispy spicy tuna. Those Philippe Starck designed restaurants can learn from how they do it at Blue Wasabi. Order it. Trust me... Next was the Marilyn Monroll ($14.75). It's tuna, yellowtail, spicy tuna & salmon alongside avocado, cucumber & crab wrapped in a big roll of pink soy paper. It was good. Dont try to scarf it in one bite unless you're ready for the heimlich. It's a biggie... Next up was the Yo Adrian! of Rocky Balboa fame. It's a roll with crab, cream cheese topped with smoked salmon. Good stuff... Next was the kaboom roll ($13.50). It's a plate of cut california rolls with a mound of baked shrimp dynamite topping it. Good stuff. It tasted great. It's a lot of food on one plate. Delicious... Next was the bad boy of the bunch. The dirty sanchez ($13.75)... it's a tempura battered roll with eel, crab, cream cheese topped with a teriyaki-like sauce. It was very good. And I do not normally mess with any rolls with cream cheese but I would order this again & again. It was quite tasty... Next on the menu was the wango mango ($8.25) roll which has spicy krab in a mango sauce encompassed in soy paper. It wasnt one of my favorites. It wasnt bad. Just not as good as the rest... Next up was the grammy award winning tail-er swift roll ($9.75). It was made up of spicy yellowtail wrapped in soy paper topped with yellowtail sashimi & avocado. It was very good. The flavors & texture went very well together. Good stuff... 

I have to say I was very impressed overall with Blue Wasabi. The staff was great. From Kathy our awesome waitress, to the manager who assured us of a table to our liking to Jim the owner who treated us like family. It was a great, memorable dinner of good times & good food and drinks. Jim the owner recognized my friend & her husband as ones (she) that asked why there werent any coconut flavors in any of their specialty martini drinks. Jim said he would have something to her liking when they returned and sure enough there was a drink named after them (her husband). The infamous MAGIC MIKE.... Hahaha... Awesome. Order it ladies! or gentlemen... Whoever you are, just order it! Jim also showed us some aloha by insisting we add to our order of the dessert banana nut spring roll (DELISH) to celebrate our birthdays, by adding the chocolate rainbow roll (YUM) and comping us both of them. What?!? How cool is that?? That was above & beyond... Oh and that Magic Mike drink was on him as well since my friends were the couple that inspired its creation.... Amazing.

All I know is our whole experience from Kathy to Jim and the stellar dishes that were served and thoroughly enjoyed by our party has given me no choice but to be a customer of this fine establishment every time I'm in town. Thank you Jim. And thank you Blue Wasabi.

I have to start off hb saying that our waitress, Paula, may have been one of the best waitresses I have ever had. If every waitress at this restaurant is like her, it is no wonder they are so busy. She was incredibly helpful with food and beverage recommendations and all the food was delicious! I highly recommend the spicy garlic edamame, Chuck Norris roll, and buttah face drink for dessert! I will definitely be returning as soon as I can.
Best martinis! Tuesday is ladies night $4.75 martinis!! Service was amazing, loved all the martinis we tried and we tried 3 each! Super quick service!yummy yummy yummy!

This place was hit and miss for me. Two of the rolls we had were excellent, the Marilyn Monroll and the Surf & Turf. The Marilyn was really fresh and clean tasting with a soft texture, due to the pink rice paper, and a great taste. The Surf & Turf was my favorite, and one of my favorites I've ever had. It's hard to find a roll with beef tenderloin on top and even harder to find a good one. The texture and flavor on this baby were outstanding and I loved every bite. The sake we had was really good... Kikui I think was it's name or something close. Now on to the let down. We ordered a Dirty Sanchez roll and it was very poorly executed. You would think a completely different person did it. It was completely falling apart and the tempura batter on the outside was almost nonexistent and very uneven. Each component had to practically be eaten separately because it was so sloppy. I also ordered the Key West martini because I love Key Lime martinis, and although it was good, it was more like a vanilla milkshake and I couldn't taste anything close to a lime at all. Pretty bad when your place advertises itself as a martini bar. Better get those right. All and all it was a good experience and the decor is modern and hip. The actual blue wasabi they give you is a nice touch too. It's not cheap though and if you can I recommend going during happy hour.

Great environment, staff was friendly and service was fast. Prices were higher but the food quality and choices made up for it. Between all of us we had about 8 rolls and each was very good and the blue wasabi was a nice added touch. The restaurant was very busy and the spaces are compact so you got to meet who you were around. It was loud and hard to carry on a conversation but overall we enjoyed ourselves.

When it comes to reviewing a place where we dine occasionally it's hard to know if I should write about our general expierence or what will probably be our last visit there. 

I feel they are a bit overpriced so we usually go during happy hour where the half price drinks and sushi bring it down to normal price ranges. It is almost always crowded and you'll almost always have to wait to find a seat. It's not a very child friendly restaurant either with very high tables and chairs. 

Generally though the service is good and the food is good. We got the stuffed mushrooms last time which I believe are new and they were delicious. 

However after our last expierence I don't think we'll be coming back. We tried to bring the kids to this visit and were reminded why we never do. After 2 table changes we finally just tried to hold the baby on our lap at a booth. One thing to note is we are a mixed race family so we do occasionally get some weird questions when we are out together but we were asked 3 times if we were on seperate checks as if the waitress could not believe people of different races could be together. 

Her disbelief apparently only escalated from there. The baby was acting ridiculous so I took her outside while we waited for the food. The mushrooms I mentioned above were new so when they came out my wife didn't know we ordered them and said they had the wrong order (my mistake). The waitress came out and said "that man" ordered them. She said "you mean my husband?" the waitress said "I guess that man outside with the baby". At the end of the meal I took the baby outside again and said "Just give her the check" pointing to my wife. The waitress brought the check over to my wife and said "that man said you were going to get the check? is that ok? are you ok to take the check?"

Very uncomfortable meal. Not a good expierence. Maybe send the staff to some kinda diversity training or something.

I've been here twice, I'm a sushi newbie but what I had I enjoyed.  My particular favorite seems to be the Yo Adrian.  The red hot chilli pepper and Marilyn one are good as well.  I haven't tried any of the drinks or small plates yet but they look good.

Service at bar and drink was good. You'd be surprised how hard it is to get a filthy martini on the first try.  The rolls had cute names but for the price lacked any real pop in flavor. Overall, it's an ok spot. Doesn't know if it's a trendy spot or a sports bar though.

SOOO GOOOD!!  We really enjoyed the sushi, the California rolls with Shrimp dyamite  were awesome.  We also had one with mandarin and cream cheese that was so good.  They also offer a happy hours but we missed it by 30 minutes.  It was really loud on the inside.  So it might be better on the outside if you are trying to converse.  The rolls were large like sushi on steroids.

If you don't care about service then you won't have a problem here. The sushi was good. Very creative and fun menu. The spicy shrimp is delicious, but a little pricy. 
As far as a service, it was AWFUL and I won't return because of that. Our waiter was rude and pushy. We were waiting at our table for our friends and told him our party was on their way. He asked us about 3 times after we told him. He was not friendly at all and unprofessional. Didn't even say thank you when we all left as we walked pass him.

They kill in customer service, overall atmosphere is awesome. Great lighting and sushi chefs are very informative on what everything is! Will definitely be back during the week for happy hour. #HotSakiBombs!!!

We've heard mixed reviews from our friends about this place. Mostly that it was more a bar than a sushi restaurant. We decided to try it anyway since it was open later than our 2 usual spots. We were pleasantly surprised. Our waiter was great, super helpful with explaining their menu and gave some great recommendations. 

The Surf and Turf roll would have been good if there hadn't been some sort of sauce on it that I just didn't like that much. Their salmon nigiri was good, the yellowtail was a little too fishy for me but I'm very picky when it comes to yellowtail. I forgot what else we ordered but it was pretty good iirc. Their prices are a bit on the high side if you miss happy hour. We might stop by here again, but it just wasn't good enough to topple our two favorite places.
Went with a friend and figured I go with an open mind. Sushi was horrible not fresh and lots of imitation crab and imitation fish used. Sushi smelled fishy never a good sign. Will not go again.

Sushi is decent but very spendy. I don't care for the loud music or bad lighting. We've been there approx. 4 different times, staff not so friendly. Of all the places to choose from in the E. Valley now, this would not be our first choice.

A Scottsdale favorite.  This is a great little sushi bar even though it is out in the boonies of northeast Scottsdale.  Small, breezy, casual but stylish, and fun.  They really did manage to blend a sushi and martini bar pretty seamlessly.  It can be a little bit of a scene and it is definitely an older well-heeled crowd due to its proximity to DC Ranch.  

The food is great.  Very creative sushi rolls.  If you are a purist, you will HATE IT.  I am a fan of good food, so I LOVE IT. One example:

Where's the Beef Tempura roll with seared beef tenderloin, asparagus, avocado and shrimp, lightly fried and drizzled with a sweet soy glaze. And the martinis are smashing.  

TIP:  I went on a Sunday last summer and they gave us a big discount because I was wearing blue.  It was 50% off, I think.  I hope they do this every summer...
